metadata.Title: CVE-2022-29404 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In Apache HTTP Server 2.4.53 and earlier, a malicious request to a lua script that calls r:parsebody(0) may cause a denial of service due to no default limit on possible input size.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-29404` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

apache2 - 2.4.54-2ubuntu1
apache2-bin - 2.4.54-2ubuntu1
apache2-data - 2.4.54-2ubuntu1
apache2-suexec-custom - 2.4.54-2ubuntu1
apache2-suexec-pristine - 2.4.54-2ubuntu1
apache2-utils - 2.4.54-2ubuntu1
libapache2-mod-md - 2.4.54-2ubuntu1
libapache2-mod-proxy-uwsgi - 2.4.54-2ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: apache2 package in kinetic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.54-2ubuntu1').
